contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2013}} [[File:Flickr - boellstiftung - Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker.jpg|thumb|Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker (2010)]] '''Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker''' (born June 25, 1939 in [[Zürich]], [[Switzerland]]) is a [[Germany|German]] scientist and politician. He is son of the physicist [[Carl Friedrich von Weizsäcker]] and nephew of the former German President [[Richard von Weizsäcker]]. He wrote the books ''Factor Four: Doubling Wealth, Halving Resource Use'' (1995), its followup, [[Factor_5_(book)|Factor 5]] (2009) and ''Limits to Privatization''. He was founder and president (1991–2000) of the [[Wuppertal Institute]] and member of the [[Club of Rome]] since 2001. In 2011, he was elected co-president of the Club of Rome. Since 1966 he has been a member of the [[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]]. Between 1998 and 2005 he was member of the [[Bundestag|German Parliament]]. He received the [[Takeda Awards|Takeda Award]] in 2001. He currently sits on the Advisor Board for the [[German Foundation for World Population]]. In 2005 he was appointed dean of the [[Bren School of Environmental Science & Management]] at the [[University of California, Santa Barbara]]. In 2010, Weizsäcker gave a lecture at [[Saint Anselm College]] in [[Goffstown, New Hampshire]], discussing global climate change.<ref>http://www.anselm.edu/nhiop/news+and+events/events/2010-04-08-weizsaecker.htm</ref> He is a member of the [[World Future Council]]. ==See also== *[[Hunter Lovins]] *[[Factor 5: A Convenient Truth]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://ernst.weizsaecker.de Website of Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker] * [http://www.bren.ucsb.edu/people/Faculty/ernst_von_weizsacker.htm Homepage of Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker at the Bren School] {{Authority control|VIAF=98298424}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Weizsacker, Ernst Ulrich von | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German noble | DATE OF BIRTH = June 25, 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Weizsacker, Ernst Ulrich von}} [[Category:Members of the Bundestag]] [[Category:People from the canton of Zurich]] [[Category:Weizsäcker family|Ernst Ulrich]] [[Category:German untitled nobility]] [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the European Academy of Sciences and Arts]] [[Category:Non-fiction environmental writers]] [[Category:Commanders Crosses of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany]]
